Subjective: Right eye redness and irritation since Tuesday; feels like hair or dust in eye; no vision problems or light sensitivity; no other symptoms; no recent eye products; no family history; no trauma; no contact lens use; no pain except when squeezing eyes shut; no flu-like symptoms; no home issues; managing well with child; first time eye issue.
Objective: Right eye: redness, visible veins, no foreign body, no abnormalities; left eye: starting to show redness; pupils reactive to light; no vision problems.
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis in right eye, likely spreading to left eye; no signs of bacterial infection or other complications.
Plan: Use artificial tears for comfort (available at pharmacy)
Clean eyes with lukewarm tap water and cotton pad in the morning
Follow up if symptoms persist after 2 weeks or if pain, pus, or vision changes occur
